content: as the base of your bag will not want to bunch up around the needles * ● optional dpns in one size smaller than your main project needles for i-cord drawstring ● 8 stitch markers i used them to mark increases/decreases on the base making sure 1 is a different color than the others ● tapestry or yarn needle to weave in ends ● scissors ● crochet hook might be helpful when picking up stitches but is not required i used 5 5 mm hook for bulky yarn forming the first layer of the base using two double pointed needles in us 10 6 5mm us 4 3 5 mm cast on 8 sts using judy s magic cast-on or figure-eight cast on set-up round k all stitches keeping them on only 2 needles round 1 increase by kfb of each st i transfer sts to 4 dpn s as i work this round = 16 sts rounds 2 and all even rounds k all sts round 3 *kfb k1* repeat from * to end of round = 24 sts round 5 *kfb k2* around =32 sts round 7 *kfb k3* repeat from * to end of round = 40 sts round 9 *kfb k4* repeat from * to end of round = 48 sts at this point i find placing markers before every increase to be helpful in keeping track of the increase but place markers when you prefer continue increasing every other round until you have 12 19 sts between stitch markers or a total of 96 152 sts ending on a knit round purl one round this is the turning round making the second layer of the base set up round k full round round 1 *k2tog k to m sm* repeat from * to end of round round 2 and all even rounds knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until 16 stitches are left repeat round 1 one more time = 8 sts left cut yarn and use tapestry needle to thread tail through all 8 stitches removing them from needles tighten yarn tail and weave in ends tying the tails from beginning and ending together and hide tails between layers the base of your basket should be knit fabric only on both sides sides or body of bag using 24 inch circular needles pick up 96 152 stitches one row away from the purl bump edge to ensure your bag is knit right-side-out lay base on your lap or a table with the nicest layer facing down this will be the outside of the bag and needs to look nice starting on the edge of the base closest to you lift the base off the table so you are looking at the bottom poke the needle or crochet hook from back to front top to bottom through a stitch along this top edge and grab a loop of thread pull it through to the back and place it on the needle repeat using the stitches
